subject: Re: [junit] Does JUnit TestCase terminate threads?

messageBody:
James,
You meant the TestCase to do some response delay validation & behavior
under multi-threading.
Yes in this case the run() methods are synchronized if you read the
documentation well.
If you look well at the source code of the Multi-threaded test cases the
Threads with your Runnable are created & initialized. Then when all the
Threads are ready to run the test case goes over all the Threads & call
the

Thread.start();

There's right after that a join() of ALL the Threads hence you don't
move much further before all the Threads are effectively running out of
their " run() " methods.


Regards,

Thomas,
